Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: Denny
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Seiki Model SE60GY24 TV because of the screen size and $499 clearance price at Sears. I'm using an antennae mounted on a tower. So I do have HD reception. The picture is fair, but not great, like our Samsung TVs. Also, the tuner is slow to respond when changing stations. I've found this is a problem on some cheaper TVs. Also, you cannot "look ahead" to view future TV programs using the info button. You can view the current program title and info. I guess that's another Samsung feature I enjoyed. Another flaw is the color tint control is "greyed out" and not user adjustable. I've never encountered this before in a TV. So, I emailed Seiki customer service and recommend a programming/service update to correct this issue. No response on that idea. So, I called customer service. There's no correcting the non adjustable tint feature. The only color tint adjustment is to use the color temperature control. I decided to keep the TV because of the screen size, which I like in the living room. For the price, it is useable. Someday, this will be a recreation room TV, when the larger screen Samsung LED TVs are reduced in price.
